alert.note: Alert for Greene; Pickens; Sumter (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 25 at 8:26PM CST until January 30 at 3:25AM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Alabama... Tombigbee River At Bevill Lock and Dam affecting Greene, Sumter and Pickens Counties. Tombigbee River At Gainesville Lock and Dam affecting Greene, Sumter and Marengo Counties. Tombigbee River At Demopolis Lock and Dam affecting Greene, Marengo, Sumter and Hale Counties. .The Tombigbee River continues to rise and flood warning remain in effect. The next statement will be issued Friday morning at 1130 AM CST. && ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tombigbee River at Bevill Lock and Dam. * WHEN...Until early Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 122.0 feet, Cattle in low-lying areas of Southern Pickens County should be moved to higher ground. Cattle are cutoff in lowlands of Southern Pickens County at stages above 122 feet. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CST Thursday the stage was 123.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:00 PM CST Thursday was 123.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 124.9 feet Saturday evening. It will then fall below flood stage Monday afternoon. - Flood stage is 122.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
